sub_title: Looking for a Traineeship in the HR department or a Project Management position!
summary:
Willing to relocate for the postion!

After realizing that a career in politics or political culture wasn't my calling while working in a call center, I redirected myself towards business and managements. I successfully completed a Pre-Master and Master of Science in Human Resources Management, with little prior knowledge in business. All through which I engaged in volunteering activities and committee work.

Thanks to these multiple experiences, I have acquired a thirst for challenges and continual learning, as well as acquired many skills. Among others, this includes rapid skill acquisition, being a team player and a leader when needed, managing multiple tasks and deadlines, and good customer/people relation. 

Contact: manonsieurin@gmail.com

school.name: Lycée Français Vincent Van Gogh - The Hague

certifications.name: Master of Science Human Resources Management
Learning Community: Working with Agile Project Management Tools

projects.title: Erasmus in Schools Project - Groningen
projects.description:
Part of this year round project, the ESN Social Eramus committee organize a couple of events where international university students meet with local school kids. While being Project Coordinator, I organized:

- Kinderboekenweek 2017 (4th to 15th October) activities between ESN and Tamarisk DaltonSchool, where 8 international students presented spooky stories or celebrations to children between 8 and 12 years olds.

- Culture Week (27th November to 1st December) between ESN and the Augustinus CSG, where 15 international students presented their country and culture to Dutch high school students (12-18 y/o) during their English class.

- Culture Week Dinner (16th January), organized by Augustinus CSG and ESN, where the students of the Culture Week would discuss with students studying for the Cambridge English exam.

- Sprachdhof (23rd February) organized by ESN and Willem Lodewijk Gymnasium, where 25 international german-speaking students met and engaged in discussions with 120 local high schoolers in German.

contributors.headline: Looking for a Traineeship in the HR department or a Project Management position!

projects.title: Business Challenge 2017: Shell
projects.description:
This Business Challenge was a 6-week intense competition, where multi-disciplinary student teams were required to choose and manage a portfolio. During these 6 weeks, events would occur and affect the portfolio. The end product was to deliver a report defining our strategic choice of portfolio and advice for Shell to deal with these events, to meet with the growing demand for energy and to be more economically, environmentally and socially responsible. These results and advice were presented in front of a panel of Shell senior executives and FEB-professors.

The competition included company visits, guest lectures, coaching, mentoring and workshops.  The competition also provided insights into the energy industry, through these 6 weeks of part-time research for Shell. Certificates were awarded at the end of the competition, vouching for the attained skills.

The consulting project was supervised by the EBF association, University of Groningen, the Career Company, and Shell.

contributors.headline: Looking for a Traineeship in the HR department or a Project Management position!
Executive Secretary at the Ministry of Agriculture Nature and Food Quality

projects.title: Business Challenge 2017: Kentalis
projects.description:
Business Challenges are a 9-week competition where students investigate a real managerial issue. Multi-disciplinary teams battle for the best observations, recommendations and overall advice. The competition includes company visits, guest lectures and workshops. Certificates are awarded for participation vouching for the attained skills.

The Case: Organization design of regional partnerships for Kentalis (and their chain partners).
Main Research Question: Develop a framework to develop future Public-Private Partnerships of chain partners and Kentalis, regarding regional primary/secondary education and health care of deaf, hard of hearing students and students with development language impairments, based on the emerging decentralized customers' market demand.

The consulting project was supervised by the University of Groningen, the Career Company, and the NGO Royal Dutch Kentalis.

courses.name: Master Courses: Master’s Thesis, Strategic HRM, Personnel Instruments, Research & Professional Skills for HRM, Work Design & Team Processes, Leadership, Personnel Economics, HRM & International Labour Law, IT Governance

UM BA Y1: Apollo & Dionysus (Intro in Ethics), Academic Skills, Knowledge & Criticism, Reading Philosophy, Research & Writing I, Disenchantment & Ideology, Debates among Historians, Style & Modernity, Analysis of Paintings and Literary Texts.

UM BA Y2-3 Major Political Culture: The European State, Political History of the 20th c., Power & Democracy, Global Justice & Human Rights, The Appeal of Totalitarianism, Researching Political Culture, BA Thesis.
UM BA Y2: Network Society, Close to the Foreign, Cultural Pluralism, Theory of Science & Interdisciplinary, Research & Writing II, Portfolio-Coaching

UM BA Y3 Minor A Non-European Modernity - India in a Globalizing World: A Nation and its Fragments - Democracy/Political Economy/Globalization, Living with Differences - Politics of Culture, Nation-Building: Science/Technology/Modernity

profile_positions.description:
⇒ Goals
- Ensuring the relevance and correctness of employees' information in the system
- Ensuring the employees' access to their information and relevant documents
- Ensuring that the work instructions are up-to-date.

⇒ Responsibilities:
- Entering new employees in the system
- Entering and modifying employee data in the systems (personal, leave,...)
- Modifying and ensuring the correctness of employee contracts regarding their position, their place of work and contractual hours
- Checking the correctness of the data entered by stores (check lists) and by other colleagues (four-eyes system)
- Ensuring the correctness of the information sent to payrolling (leave, expenses, ...)
- Answering questions from store and employees regarding contracts, payroll, employee data, leave...
- Providing translations of French documents/texts to non-French speaking colleagues

⇒ Achievement:
- Training new employees in the team 2 months after starting.
- Reviewed and updated all work instructions for used processes (or created missing work instructions) for the "Employment" Team, leading to the simplification of some processes.
- Being a point of contact between the team and the local HR department for day-to-day operational issues.
- Participated in the Pilot of the implementation of Kronos for France.
- Assisted the Team Leader with task organization, training and other daily taks

Software: SAP HR, Softbrick, TopDesk, Kronos
Knowledge of French Labour Law

Action has more than 1350 open stores over 7 countries, and is employing more than 46.000 employees (stores + HQ).

profile_positions.description:
Part of the Teaching Assistantship corps of the Bachelor and Pre-Master course "Human Resources Management for B&M".

⇒ Goals
- Support the teaching staff in relations to the course
- Ensuring the good communication between students, speakers and teachers
- Ensuring the good development of the course for students

⇒ Responsibilities
- Being the contact person for students during the entirety of the course 
- Communicating information (e.g. requirements, deadlines, etc.) to students via the Nestor application
- Handling students questions, requests or problems regarding the course's characteristics 
- Maintain record of students' enrollment, assignments submissions and results.
- Grading student assignments and exam questions
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
⇒ Goals of the Human Resources Management Master Community:

⇒ Responsibilities:

- Managing the social media of the Master Community (Facebook, LinkedIN and website)

- Promoting the Master Community to Pre-Master HRM and prospective students

~~~ Secretary ~~~
- Registering participants to the events and communicating with them during these events
- Managing and registering students to the Study Dropbox
- Answering student questions about events or study-related matters
- Responsible for meeting minutes

⇒ Achievement:
- Moderated a Panel Discussion

⇒ Other Activities:

- Received training in (inter-)cultural communication and creative problem-solving
profile_positions.title: Secretary & Public Relations - Master Community HRM

profile_positions.description:
⇒ Goals:
- Introducing international university students to Dutch culture
- Encouraging interaction between international and local dutch students
- Sharing knowledge between international and local dutch students (culture/linguistic)

⇒ Responsibilities:
- Entertaining good relations between ESN and partnering schools
- Organizing and planning school-related activities
- Promoting school-related activities to international students on social media 
- Managing the day-to-day activities

⇒ Other Achievement:
- Raised about 300€ for charities

For specific organized activities, see projects below.

⇒ Other activities:
- Helping the committee with the other non-school activities (promotion, planning, ...)
- Organizing a Charity Bake Sale to raise money for charities
- Promoting ESN during Open Days to potential and new students
- Promoting Social Erasmus during ESN Intro Weeks
- Created a Newsletter to increase the committee reach in the student community

The SocialERASMUS Committee gives international students the opportunity to enrich their stay abroad by giving back to the local community. The committee fosters inter-cultural exchanges and contribution to serious matters in a fun, interpersonal and social way (e.g. cooking for the homeless community or raising money for charity through a bake sale). The activities relate to eight pillars: animal, disasters, discrimination, education, environment, health, poverty, and violence.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Introduction Weeks are week-long events organized by ESN, which welcomes new (international/exchange) students to the city of Groningen (NL). 

⇒ Volunteering during ESN Introduction Weeks in:
- 2016 (26th-30th Jan, 31st Aug - 3rd Sept)
- 2017 (1st - 6th Feb, 30th Aug - 4th Sept)
- 2018 (27th Jan - 2nd Feb)

⇒ Responsibilities:
- Welcoming participants
- Registering them for the events (including cash/card payments)
- Setting up and animating activities/workshop
- Signing up and guiding students to activities
- Helping the core team during some activities (guard door, check for tickets, wardrobe...)

company.name: Experience Groningen - Beyond the Student Bubble

volunteer_experiences.description:
Experience Groningen is an annual weekend event intended for international students to leave their 'student bubble' and experience the city and the province differently. By meeting with companies, associations or event team, they are given the opportunity to see Groningen (and part of the province) in a different light.

⇒ Volunteered in:
- 2016 (11-12 March)
- 2017 (10-11 March)

⇒ Responsibility:
- Leading and managing a team of 10 people around the city
- Making sure they felt welcomed and comfortable throughout the event

Website: http://www.experiencegroningen.com/

⇒ Goal:
- Ensure a smooth communication with the participants about the event through social media (Twitter and Facebook) and the local and regional press.
- Updating the website (www.tedxgorningen.com) with news and blogs about the event
- Ensuring the success of communication projects by working with the event partners (phone app and tip-line).

⇒ Responsibilities:
- Trained and worked on the Narrowcasting for the event.
- Transcribed previous TEDxGroningen videos
- Interviewed speakers about their talks and wrote blogs about it.

⇒ For my blogs:
- http://tedxgroningen.com/tedxgroningen2016/gerry-kierans/
- http://tedxgroningen.com/tedxgroningen2016/dana-petrovic/
